first.name: Harold
first.text: First, observe the giant hole in the ground the camera just focused on. That's the Rabbit Hole. |It leads directly to where the rabbits are nesting.

explanation_harold_2.name: Harold
explanation_harold_2.content: As the surveyor, my job is to monitor the state of the rabbits, and let you know when they're about to come out of their hole.

explanation_harold_3.name: Harold
explanation_harold_3.text: I can also point out potential hazard areas in the environment, such as this steep precipice.|@@If a rabbit falls too far and hits the ground...well, let's just say that would be bad for the rabbit.

explanation_harriet_2.name: Harriet
explanation_harriet_2.text: Let's take a look at the [b][color=#3399ff]Ethical Containment Chamber[/color][/b], or [b][color=#3399ff]ECC[/color][/b]. This is where we capture the rabbits and secure them for transport to one of our mass care centers. My job is to oversee the containment and transport processes, and ensure none of these valuable commodities comes to harm.

explanation_harriet_3.name: Harriet
explanation_harriet_3.content: As the Rabbit Trail Manager, your job is to get those rabbits safely from their Rabbit Hole to the ECC.

explanation_controls_harold_1.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_1.content: On that note, let's give you a brief overview of the control console, at the bottom of your screen.

explanation_controls_harold_2.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_2.content: The visa-textual screen is where other R-Tech employees or authorized third-party agents can communicate with you. If you can see me, you know where this is.

explanation_controls_harold_3.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_3.text: Next, the Statistic displays. The first one is the Rabbit Tracker, aptly indicated by the rabbit head icon.

explanation_controls_harold_4.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_4.content: You may have noticed our bionic test rabbit running around on the bottom of the screen.| Now, note the yellow '1' in the Rabbit Tracker. The yellow numbers indicate how many rabbits are out and running about.|@@The green numbers indicate how many rabbits have been captured, and the red numbers indicate how many rabbits are damaged beyond scientific usefulness.

explanation_controls_harold_4a.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_4a.content: The green numbers indicate how many rabbits have been captured, and the red numbers indicate how many rabbits are damaged beyond scientific usefulness.

harriet_interjection_1.name: Harriet
harriet_interjection_1.content: It's okay to say they're dead, you know.

explanation_controls_harold_5.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_5.content: Just using the suggested terminology from the latest revision of the company policy handbook.|@@The next Stat Display is the Budget Tracker. This shows you how much of the mission's allotted funds you have left to spend. We'll get into more detail on the budget shortly.

explanation_controls_harold_6.name: Harold
explanation_controls_harold_6.content: The last Stat Display is the Time Tracker. This keeps track of how much time you've spent on the current mission. This factors into your Employee Efficiency Index calculation during post-mission review.

explanation_eei_harold_1.name: Harold
explanation_eei_harold_1.content: EEI is how R-Tech evaluates you as an employee. Several factors go into the calculation, but the gist is this: if you capture enough rabbits, in a modestly efficient manner, you'll pass. The more rabbits you capture, and the more efficiently you do so, the better your EEI rating will be.

explanation_controls_harriet_1.name: Harriet
explanation_controls_harriet_1.content: Ai yai yai, yadda yadda yadda. Let's move on to the fun stuff: the Command Card.
